page.title: 01General Description of Area
page.content: The area covered by our survey lies on the busy A606 main road between Stamford and Nottingham. The land is gently undulating and is dominated by a large earth dam built between 1971 and 1975 to hold the water of Europe's largest manmade lake, Rutland Water. Large areas around the water have been landscaped providing facilities for walking, riding and cycling as well as fishing sailing and windsurfing on the water. There are two villages in the area, Empingham and Whitwell as well as a number of scattered farms. Both villages have a mixture of well built stone houses, converted barns, council houses and Empingham has a well laid out estate of new properties and a number of new "infilling" houses.
